comments.html:
What would be a good recommendation for an "universal engineer" today?

comments.name: Gregec

comments.html: No idea. If I ever stumble across something useful, I'll definitely write about it ;)
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html: Ivan, why don't YOU write one? :)
comments.name: Greg

comments.html:
It surprises me that so much is left out of the book (MPLS and especially NAT) and it states on their website the date for the book is February 2009. So is the second edition just a reprint of the original 2004 book with only minor updates?

I agree with Greg, you should take up the torch and improve on this book. I bet it would sell very nicely as more and more is expected from the IT people "jack of all trades".
comments.name: RobD
